reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To be honest we shouldn't have been surprised about what we experienced. It is a business hotel catering for conferences and business travellers. It's not really a tourist hotel. The superior skyline rooms offer you a great view. The rooms are clean but functional and very dark with a modernist theme. The five stars rating is simply because of the spa and gym. The bar in the basement is awful and very expensive as is the breakfast if it isn't included in your room charge. We had a problem with the air con which was a bit annoying to get fixed but that isn't the reason for the poor score. You could use your money and find a much better place to stay if you are on a weekend trip, Madrid is such a beautful city and there are plenty of hotels to choose from. It is also a fair way from the centre and there isn't anything to do nearby.
reviews.title: Business Hotel with Good Views nothing more nothing less

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 1 night in this hotel using a Groupon. The hotel is between the airport and the centre of Madrid. I didn't mind being a good 10 min taxi ride out of town (10-15 EUR), due to the spectacular view from our skylight room on the 27th floor. The room was not large but had a huge bed and nice bathroom with full bathtub and separate rain-dance shower with jets. The shower leaked and set the bathroom a little underwater - wasn't much of a problem though. With our Groupon we got some nice Lindor chocolate truffles in the room as well when we arrived. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Didn't try the SPA, but they had some nice treatments, although quite pricey. I will definitely come back on my next trip to Madrid.
reviews.title: More of a 4 star than 5

reviews.text: In May 2012 my wife and I came to this hotel for the second time. The second time was as good as the first time, maybe better.
reviews.title: Modern and elegant but lacking many 5 star services
Great stay!
reviews.text: This is a new and modern hotel lost in the deserts of Paseo de la Castellana (259B). It is situated in the Cuatro Torres Business Area with convenient connection to the center (metro line no 10, station Begoña, Salida: Hospital La Paz, 3 min walk between hotel and metro station, approx. 15 min to reach center) and Brajas airport (15-20 min by taxi and EUR 27). There seem to be nothing around but hotel itself is great and worth considering. The strongest point of this hotel is its design and service.

reviews.title: Magnificent View
reviews.text: My room was situated on 22nd floor (2215) with good panorama on the area and setting sun. I appreciated its modern style, wooden floor, comfortable bed and great bathroom in chocolate colour with bathtub and separate cabins for shower and toilet. The room had safe, minibar, flat screen TV and free and problem free WiFi connection. My air conditioning was very noisy but after a phone call at the reception a person came within 10 min to adjust the ventilation level. I also ordered room service and the food was very good and well served. The only problem was a vanity bag in the bathroom: all necessary goodies thrown in the beautiful black and gold bag with the ribbon. You have to first spend your time on removing the ribbon and throwing out the contents of the bag in a search of you soap, shampoo, conditioner etc. The liquid products have fancy plastic tubes that do not want to stand especially after 2nd use – very bad idea! There is no tissue box, so convenient but a pack of tissues – another mistake. I left my comments on it to the management.

The room had one of the best management of light and curtains I have ever seen. All in one panel at the hand reach next to your bed. Do you remember hotels where you desperately look for a switch to the particular lamp that makes you walk in the room/corridor or jump across the bed? Not in this hotel! All is clear and accessible from your bed or at the very entrance… and there is this “relax” light option that puts the lights on very but very subtle level, hardly visible but allowing you to move around the room without staying in complete darkness. Bravo for the lighting system!
reviews.title: bird’s eye view, stylish, luxurious, friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast buffet is very generous (however it opens only at 7.00 am!) and served at 30th floor with good panorama. There is a good selection of breads, pastries (including churros!), donuts, fruits, eggs and ham/sausages. To my regret I did not find any tomatoes neither cucumbers (vegetable in general) to accompany my eggs and sandwiches. I also think that muesli section could be improved by skipping packed Kelloggs cornflakes and offering some real granolas.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2 words - The Bomb! OK, so this is a little outside of the heart of the city but a cab and you are right where the tourist and shopping hub is. And it's worth the distance, for what you get for your money - tower high accommodation, chic decor, heated bathroom floors, monsoon showers, mood lit rooms and every gadget you can think off. And if you can peel yourself out of your room, then prepare to be blown away by the spa and the restaurant. This is how hotels should be done, and is possibly Eurostars jewel in their crown. Loved it!
reviews.title: High tech, high up
Not so small details
reviews.text: Modern hotel, probably the most modern in Spain. Location is ok, not close to the center, but a nice 30 min walk or 10 min cab ride. Rooms are spacious, modern, confortable, with beatiful view. However... It took me 30 min to check in on a Saturday early afternoon. To many people checking in? No, very, very slow service. Then I called reception for a wake up call the following morning. I am still waiting for it. For a hotel that intends to be 5 stars, kind of unexpected mistakes. But overall it is worth it.

reviews.title: Good price for a 5 stars
reviews.text: I've been there several times for businesses, usually we get a good rate, rooms are not big but really trendy, floors and views are high, rooms have nice shower and all electronics. The breakfast is in the 30 th floor and is really good.
Not the best location for tourists but a great hotel, stylish, free wifi, friendly staff and a nice experience overall.
reviews.title: Great experience

reviews.text: Stayed for few night at this great property during a business trip, the hotel is very modern, rooms are very clean, spacious and on the high floors you'll enjoy the views.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: This hotel is your classic business traveller hotel, with a very professional and office tower style layout, look and feel which is kind of hard to describe. There is basically no real lobby area and all the facilities and rooms are on higher floors. It is also situated within a rather bland business district on Paseo de la Castellana - so it's not really a place to walk around in the evenings (however it is pretty close to Begoña metro which connects you all over). For the business traveller it is great. Rooms are very comfortable with modern facilities, cool lighting/decor and on high floors offers great views of this awesome city. Fairly reasonable rates can be found if you trawl the net and the piano lounge style bar on one of the high floors is very Singaporean/Hong Kong jazz bar style.
reviews.title: Boring area, slick hotel
